str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Bread, a loaf, food. From airo; bread or a loaf.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

str2: To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

str2: To be hungry, needy, desire earnestly. From the same as penes; to famish; figuratively, to crave.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

str2: To thirst for, desire earnestly. From a variation of dipsos; to thirst for.
